required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: LPN in Patients With High-complex Renal Tumors
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Laparoscopic Partial Nephrectomy Versus Laparoscopic Radical Nephrectomy in Patients With High-Complexity Renal Tumors: A Propensity Score Matched Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: The study aims to investigate the rationale for LPN in patients with high-complexity renal tumors in terms of oncologic and functional outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: From November 2009 to October 2018, 399 patients underwent LPN and 307 patients to laparoscopic radical nephrectomy (LRN). 41 patients with RENAL score ≥ 10 enrolled in LPN and 265 patients to the LRN group. Propensity score matching (matched by age, gender, clinical tumor stage, tumor size, baseline renal function, comorbidities such as diabetes mellitus (DM), hypertension (HT), coronary artery disease (CAD), and final tumor pathology of RCC) was used to reduce selection bias. Functional and oncological outcomes were compared between the two groups. After propensity score analysis, 39 patients in the LRN group were matched with 39 in the LPN group.

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the surgery
primary_outcome.description: time from onset to complete of surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the end of the surgery
at the and of the surgery
primary_outcome.description: The clamp time of the renal artery and vein which is required to complete tumor excision and renorrhaphy
abnormal problmes that may be seen after surgery and require additional intervention, treatment or follow-up
serum creatinine level (mg /dL) and estimated glomerular filtration rate (CKD Epidemiology Collaboration (CKD-EPI) equation) (mL/min/1.73 m2)

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperative follow-up, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: presence or absence of tumors at the surgical margin

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperative follow-up, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: evaluation of preoperative and postoperative renal functions according to chronic kidney disease stages

primary_outcome.time_frame: postoperative follow-up, through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Presence or absence of local and/or distal tumor recurrence

arm_group.description: 39 patients with high complexity renal tumors who underwent laparoscopic partial nephrectomy
39 patients with high complexity renal tumors who underwent laparoscopic radical nephrectomy

intervention.description: Completely removal of kidney by using laparoscopic surgery

study_pop.textblock: From November 2009 to October 2018, 399 patients underwent LPN and 307 patients to laparoscopic radical nephrectomy (LRN). 41 patients with RENAL score ≥ 10 enrolled in LPN and 265 patients to the LRN group. Propensity score matching (matched by age, gender, clinical tumor stage, tumor size, baseline renal function, comorbidities such as diabetes mellitus (DM), hypertension (HT), coronary artery disease (CAD) and final tumor pathology of RCC) was used to reduce selection bias. Functional and oncological outcomes were compared between the two groups. After propensity score analysis, 39 patients in the LRN group were matched with 39 in the LPN group.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with complete data
- Patients with single renal tumor on the effected side
- Patients who approved the written consent form
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who not approved the written consent form
- Patients with incomplete data
- Patients with low or mild complexity renal tumors
